Class KaratsubaImplementation<T>

java.lang.Object
karatsuba.KaratsubaImplementation<T>

public class KaratsubaImplementation<T> extends Object implements karatsuba.Karatsuba
This class will handle the karatsuba formula implementation

    • multiply

      public int multiply(int x, int y)
      this method is the main method to multiply the two numbers it'll recursively call itself to separate all double digit and above into abcd and compute the karatsuba formula to return the result
      Specified by:
      multiply in interface karatsuba.Karatsuba
      Parameters:
      x - any integer to multiply
      y - any integer to multiply
      Returns:
      will return the final integer result of the multiplication of x and y

    • intFragmenter

      public int[] intFragmenter(String[] xyStr, int n)
      This method will divide x and y into four parts should only be used after strings are normalized
      Specified by:
      intFragmenter in interface karatsuba.Karatsuba
      Parameters:
      xyStr - String array with x and y values as strings
      n - Size of the numbers
      Returns:
      will return an int array with the abcd values

    • intNormalizer

      public String[] intNormalizer(int x, int y)
      This method exists to add left zeroes to the strings to make their size even and equal it is necessary to make sure that the fragmenter does its job properly and avoid fragmenting into unneven or odd sized numbers
      Specified by:
      intNormalizer in interface karatsuba.Karatsuba
      Parameters:
      x - first number to multiply
      y - second number to multiply
      Returns:
      will return a string array with x and y both normalized

    • addLeftZero

      public String addLeftZero(String str)
      This method exists only to add some clearance while reading the code
      Parameters:
      str - Number string
      Returns:
      add the string with a left zero appended

    • isEven

      public boolean isEven(int numb)
      This method will check if the input is even or odd and return a boolean true if even and false if odd
      Parameters:
      numb - Integer number
      Returns:
      will return a boolean with true if even and false if odd
